Detailed Description

Class Window. Base class for all windows.
Author:
Tapio Auvinen

Member Function Documentation

void Window::addComponent (  UIComponent *  component  ) 
 

Adds a gui component to the window. All components must be added with this function. They are removed when window closes.

Parameters:
*component component to be added

void Window::close (  int  returnValue  ) 
 

Closes window.

Parameters:
returnValue Value that will be returned by open(). Following values are recommended: 0: back to main menu or quit 1: next window

UIComponent * Window::findComponent (  int  x,
int  y
) 
 

Finds out if there is a component at these coordinates. NOTE: If components are overlapping, the first one found is returned.

Parameters:
x location, screen coordinates
y location, screen coordinates
Returns:
pointer to the component. NULL if no component was found.

int Window::open (   )  [virtual]
 

Opens the window. This won't return until the window closes. All input handling is done by the window.

Returns:
Returns a return value that may reflect users choise.

Reimplemented in WindowGame.

Parameters:

Default show action. Updates screen.

virtual void Window::step (  int  timestep  )  [inline, virtual]
 

Step is called periodically by Window::open(). Add here stuff that has to be updated regularly.

Parameters:
timestep timestep in milliseconds

Reimplemented in WindowCreateWorld, WindowCredits, WindowGame, WindowGameOver, WindowLocations, and WindowShop.

void Window::update (   ) 
 

Redraws every component on the screen.
